title: [$500] Request money get $250 not formatted correctly

comments.body: Triggered auto assignment to @mallenexpensify (`Bug`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/14418 for more details.

### Bug0 Triage Checklist ([Main S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418))

- [ ] This "bug" occurs on a supported platform (ensure `Platforms` in OP are ✅)
- [ ] This bug is not a duplicate report (check [E/App issues](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues) and [#expensify-bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM))
    - If it is, comment with a link to the original report, close the issue and add any novel details to the original issue instead
- [ ] This bug is reproducible using the reproduction steps in the OP. [S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418#:~:text=The%20bug%20is%20reproducible)
    - If the reproduction steps are clear and you're unable to reproduce the bug, check with the reporter and QA first, then close the issue.
    - If the reproduction steps aren't clear and you determine the correct steps, please update the OP.
- [ ] This issue is filled out as thoroughly and clearly as possible
    - Pay special attention to the title, results, platforms where the bug occurs, and if the bug happens on staging/production.
- [ ] I have reviewed and subscribed to the linked Slack conversation to ensure Slack/Github stay in sync
Triggered auto assignment to Contributor-plus team member for initial proposal review - @fedirjh (`External`)

Proposal from @allroundexperts 

## Proposal
### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
Request money, get $250 not formatted correctly.
### What is the root cause of that problem?
We have added an extra space [here](https://github.com/allroundexperts/Expensify/blob/2b024fa79ba18283c6462f6219a41cf7fe867106/src/languages/en.ts#L1923)
### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?
<!-- DO NOT POST CODE DIFFS -->
Just remove the extra space [here](https://github.com/allroundexperts/Expensify/blob/2b024fa79ba18283c6462f6219a41cf7fe867106/src/languages/en.ts#L1923).
### What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)
None
<!---
ATTN: Contributor+
You are the first line of defense in making sure every proposal has a clear and easily understood problem with a "root cause". Do not approve any proposals that lack a satisfying explanation to the first two prompts. It is CRITICALLY important that we understand the root cause at a minimum even if the solution doesn't directly address it. When we avoid this step we can end up solving the wrong problems entirely or just writing hacks and workarounds.
Instructions for how to review a proposal:
1. Address each contributor proposal one at a time and address each part of the question one at a time e.g. if a solution looks acceptable, but the stated problem is not clear then you should provide feedback and make suggestions to improve each prompt before moving on to the next. Avoid responding to all sections of a proposal at once. Move from one question to the next each time asking the contributor to "Please update your original proposal and tag me again when it's ready for review".
2. Limit excessive conversation and moderate issues to keep them on track. If someone is doing any of the following things please kindly and humbly course-correct them:
- Posting PRs.
- Posting large multi-line diffs (this is basically a PR).
- Skipping any of the required questions.
- Not using the proposal template at all.
- Suggesting that an existing issue is related to the current issue before a problem or root cause has been established.
- Excessively wordy explanations.
3. Choose the first proposal that has a reasonable answer to all the required questions.
-->

# Proposal

## Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
Request money, get $250 not formatted correctly.

## Root cause
We have extra space here:
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/aeced9a93f987acfe17427c241736856fba3a980/src/languages/en.ts#L1923

## Changes
We need to remove the space
https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/aeced9a93f987acfe17427c241736856fba3a980/src/languages/en.ts#L1923

This should be handled as follow-up of https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/30372
cc: @waterim @cubuspl42 @puneetlath

## Proposal

### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
Request money, get $250 is not formatted correctly.

### What is the root cause of that problem?
There is an extra space before an amount.

### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?
Remove that extra space before an amount.

### What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)
None

## Proposal ### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue. Request money get $250 not formatted correctly ### What is the root cause of that problem? We have an extra space here, https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/475d239621cf9e681319165ff05696990429bd04/src/languages/en.ts#L1923 ### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem? We need to remove this extra space, ``` body: `Request money from a new Expensify account. Get $${CONST.REFERRAL_PROGRAM.REVENUE} once they start an annual subscription with two or more active members and make the first two payments toward their Expensify bill.` ``` ### What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional) NA ### Result:
@fedirjh , please review the above, reckon it'll be a pretty quick fix.  Let me know if you'd like me to loop in a designer to confirm anything.  Thx

> Please review the above, reckon it'll be a pretty quick fix.

@mallenexpensify BTW It's an easy simple fix, I would agree with @situchan https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/31554#issuecomment-1819230389 as the offending PR is still in the regression period. In case we want to fix it separately, then @allroundexperts [proposal](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/31554#issuecomment-1819222079) looks good.
@mallenexpensify, @fedirjh Uh oh! This issue is overdue by 2 days. Don't forget to update your issues!

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 1.4.0-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** y **Reproducible in production?:** seems new feature **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @allroundexperts **Slack conversation:** https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1700345578210519 ## Action Performed: 1. Click on the `+` fab 2. Request money 3. Enter an amount and go to the participants selection step 4. Click on the `Request money, get $250` bottom alert. ## Expected Result: `Request money, get $250` text to be formatted correctly. ## Actual Result: Incorrect formatting (includes an extra space before the amount) ## Workaround: unknown ## Platforms: Which of our officially supported platforms is this issue occurring on? - [ ] Android: Native - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: Native - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos Add any screenshot/video evidence ![Screenshot 2023-11-19 at 2 27 45 AM](https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/38435837/e2c27260-814a-43fb-83ac-a8a84cc9312e) https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/38435837/e5373504-7eee-4155-ad94-4018f39ed8b0 ![New Expensify - Google Chrome](https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/38435837/b61858bc-2ee2-431d-9e65-ca2f009a50fd) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
